poem:
Title: The Vanity of Renewal

Beneath the shroud of the newspaper's pall,
Old pains dart up, rending the morn with gnaw.
Ancient beauty, dipped in venomous gall,
Year on year, we shed old sins to raw.

Yet, scorn not the season's robust rebirth,
Squint not at dawn, lest she sense your mistrust.
In each vat of self-loathing lies self worth,
Yield to growth, though it spring from age and dust.
